result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keysha N Allen

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keysha N Allen not in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Keysha N Allen.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Speedy trial demand time limits tolled due to defendant's actions.  Defendant was to appear by phone for today's hearing.  Attorney Uzowulu provides the Court with medical documentation.  Attorney was not able to reach defendant by phone.  Court wants medical documentation for next hearing.  Defendant is to appear by phone at next hearing.  Jury trial dates canceled.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Medical excuse

Defendant Keysha N Allen not in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Keysha N Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. 
Atty Uzowulu received message from Defendant was hospitalized on Monday. 
Court is asking for hospital documentation from Defendant. 
This matter will be continued to 10/18 @ 8:30 am. Defendant IS TO APPEAR by PHONE or warrant to issue.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keysha N Allen in court via video.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Keysha N Allen. Reading of complaint waived. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Defendant advised of right to and waives preliminary hearing. Court ordered defendant bound over. Probable cause found. Attorney Uzowulu requesting 30 days to set hearing for possible resolution. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Keysha N Allen not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Vivien TenHaken.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Keysha N Allen. Called @ 2:12 p.m. Appearances made. Record by Atty. Uzowulu that defendant could not call in to court due to Doctor's appointment. (Defendant lives in AZ). Asks that matter be reset to  Monday @ 1:15 p.m. No objection by the State. Matter reset.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on April 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:01pm Court in session

Defendant Keysha N Allen appeared by phone with Attorney Obi Uzowulu present in the courtroom.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  

Motion to Dismiss filed by Defense
State filed response.

Atty Uzowulu has provided the State's response to Deft, she does not agree with their response. 
Further argument by Atty Uzowulu. 

Corrections made by Deft as to travel arrangements made by Deft.

Response by Deft. 

Record by ADA Herrmann. 

Court makes record as to timeline from the first time case was filed until present. 
Court denies the Defense Motion to Dismiss for the reasons stated on the record. 

Statement made by Deft. 

Court invokes constitutional right to speedy trial from the date of the Motion to Dismiss filed (2/25/22). 

Clarification requested by ADA Herrmann


Preliminary hearing requested. 

If Deft wishes to waive her preliminary hearing the Court will allow her to do it via telephone, Atty Uzowulu to notify Court if Deft will be waiving.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Obi Uzowulu

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH ENTERPRISE RENTAL CAR. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Keysha N Allen appeared in court via telephone with attorney Obi Uzowulu. Old bond covers this file. Defendant lives out of State, Attorney Uzowulu will file change of address. Defense filed a motion to dismis. State objects, further record. Court will not deny without a hearing, Court needs more information from Defense. Next hearing, defendant may appear via phone or attorney can appear for her. Defense has 2 weeks to file more information, State has 2 weeks to file response. Minutes filed.
Motion hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion for Dismissal

Defendant Keysha N Allen in court by phone with attorney Mackenzie Renner for attorney Obi Uzowulu.  Samuel Thomas Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Attorney Renner requests initial appearance be set out to file motions. Defendant may appear via phone for next hearing. Minutes filed.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
